column5: Could someone enlighten me as to what safety equipment is required for my boat that I'm taking to Ontario to fish out of. Thank You.

PFD, Rope, whistle, or horn, flashlight. if no builge pump bailing can and if you have a built in fuel tank or inboard engine a fire extinguisher. Just go to the Transport Canada web site, www.tc.gc.ca.Mike
The requirement is the same as the state you live in. Rented boats are different and if you stay in Canada for an extended length of time. We go through this evey year....
A plastic gallon coffee container makes a great safety equipment. Cheap lightweight for flyins, Flashlight, rope, whistle, basic first aid and bailing devise all in one with lid.
You are only required to have whatever your state requires you to have for safety equipment unless your boat is in Canada for over 45 consecutive days.
